attributes.action: bring both Houses of Parliament into the 21st century by reforming forms of address
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
MPs refer to themselves as "Honourable", (everyone), "Friend" (own party), "Learned" (lawyers), and "Gallant" (past or present member of the armed forces although this is very rarely used nowadays) whereas peers refer to each other as "my Noble friend", "the Noble Lord", "the Noble and Gallant Lord", or "the Noble and Learned Lord". 
In addition MPs are known as the member for X rather than by name.

This antiquated system should be reformed and all members referred to by name either Mr, Mrs, Miss or Ms X in the Commons and Lord or Lady Y in the Lords.

They would gain great respect from the British people as the words Honourable and Noble have lost their meanings today in these applications.
